result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam Thomas Fairchild was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- 43 days credit in the event of revocation.

- Defendant to report to probation by 9 AM the following day of release from Pierce County if he doesn't meet with an agent prior to transport to Pierce County on Warrant.

- In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
- $243.00 Court Costs
- $200 DNA Surcharge 
- Defendant to pay $50 per month commencing 11/1/22 through Clerk of Court.

- DNA Sample
- Absolute sobriety
- Complete all programming as deemed appropriate by COMPAS Assessment and Department of Corrections

9:06 AM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Lindabaur. Defendant Adam Thomas Fairchild in court, in custody.  Attorney Nicholas Von Davis appeared by video for Adam Thomas Fairchild.  Prosecuting attorney Holly Elkin Rockow in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 21CT254 and 22CF544. Atty Davis recites agreement. ADA Rockow agrees. DE pleads guilty to Counts 2 and 4 in 22CF544. S/T Defendant. Court reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Court finds DE knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily waives rights and makes plea. Court accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Counts 2 and 4 in 22CF544. On motion of the State without objection, Court reads-in and dismisses Counts 1 and 3 in 22CF544 and 21CT254 in it's entirety. Sentencing arguments. Victim's rights compliance. ADA Rockow requests 2 weeks for restitution to be determined. Defendant makes statement.

Court orders: 

Count 2 in 22CF544

W/S 2 years probation
- Court Costs: $243
- DNA Sample and Surcharge: $200
- 43 days credit in the event of revocation


Count 4 in 22CF544

W/S 2 years probation
- Court Costs: $243
- DNA Sample and Surcharge: $200
- Restitution: TBD within 14 days
- 43 days credit in the event of revocation

Conditions of probation:
- Absolute sobriety
- AODA and follow through
- Complete all programming as deemed appropriate by COMPAS Assessment and Department of Corrections
- Defendant to report to probation by 9 AM the following day of release from Pierce County if he doesn't meet with an agent prior to transport to Pierce County on Warrant.

Court orders Defendant to pay $50/month commencing 11/1/22 through Clerk of Court. Adjourned at 9:20 AM.  gll

records.addlTxt:
1:58 PM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Fox, Defendant Adam Thomas Fairchild in court, in custody, pro se.  Attorney Holly Elkin Rockow in court for State of Wisconsin. Includes 21CT254 and 22CF544. 22CF544 set for a preliminary hearing. Officer is present. Defendant assumed he would have a public defender for today. Court reviews file and notes a Petition for appt of counsel has not been filed. Def wishes to have an attorney present. Court finds good cause for exceeding time limits for a preliminary hearing. Court instructs def to call PD's office and to fill out PFAC immediately, if he does not qualify for a public defender. 
Status conference scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on August 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.

The original document was titled: Pretrial Assessment
The original history event date is: 08-09-2022
Pretrial Assessment Report.

No possess of any dangerous weapons.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

01:0 PM CO: RMW with Wickstrom, REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Lindabaur. Prosecuting attorney Holly Elkin Rockow with Student Intern Ali Casey in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jeremiah Harrelson in court for Defendant for today. Includes 21CT254 RW and 22CF544 INIT. DE updates address. DE understands charges and possible penalties. Atty Harrelson states DE doesn't qualify for PD, but may if he loses his job- PFAC given.  Waive reading. Bond argument. Court orders bond in 22CF544. Court sets PH in 22CF544 and PTC in 21CT254 at same date/time. QUASH WARRANT in 21CT254.  gll
